com.immortallabs.cardboard.ui
Class ActionMap

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              com.immortallabs.cardboard.ui.ActionMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener
public class ActionMap
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener

The ActionMap translates all user interface actions into logic events. It listens for a user to press a button, keyboard key, or a menu item and sends the appropriate action to the logic

Operations:
  • The ActionMap class processes a game event command
  • The ActionMap class processes a Button
  • The ActionMap class processes a Card
  • The ActionMap class processes a clicked card
  • The ActionMap class listens for a typed key from the keyboard
  • The ActionMap class listens for a pressed key from the keyboard
  • The ActionMap class listens for a mouse press from the mouse
  • The ActionMap class listens for an action from the menu

Version:
1.4, 12/05/08
Author:
Thomas Dvornik, RustyNail CSC308 F08
See Also:
Logic, Serialized Form
Version History:
- 12/03/08 Version 1.1 Added Version History. Changed ActionMap to implement KeyListener/MouseListener and added all required methods but only need to implement keyTyped, keyPressed, and mousePressed. Added Pseudocode to those methods along with actionMap and processEvent. processEvent was overloaded to handle multiple events. Several TODOS remain.
- 12/04/08 Version 1.2 Changed package and enum names and paths.
- 12/04/08 Version 1.3 Finished enum EVENT and rough draft of psuedocode. Also updated header with added operations. - 12/05/08 Version 1.4 Changed enum to implement an abstract method. Finished second draft of psuedocode. - 01/23/09 Version 1.5 Implemented events for realease 1. This includes mouse events and a couple menu items. Mouse clicks can trigger CardBoardButtons or CardGraphics - 2/09 Version 1.5 Forgot to add a version history for release 1. This was committed sometime in February. This included the code for mouse clicks and basic menu options. (New game and exit). - 3/04/09 Version 1.6 Finished code for release two. Includes keybindings, and new menu items.

private java.util.EnumSet<ActionMap.EVENT> gameModes

gameState

private GameState gameState
The Current game Logic

gameWindow

private GameWindow gameWindow
The current game GameWindow

keyMap

private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,ActionMap.EVENT> keyMap
Maps all key strokes to the corresponding event.

noAction

private boolean noAction
Decides if an event should be processed. If false, everything gets processed. If true, something is animating or the game is paused and nothing should be done unless the card is done animating or the game is unpaused.

playerSet

private java.util.EnumSet<ActionMap.EVENT> playerSet
All events corresponding to players

timeSet

private java.util.EnumSet<ActionMap.EVENT> timeSet
All events corresponding to time

Constructor Detail

ActionMap

public ActionMap(GameState gameGameState,
                 GameWindow gameWindow)
Instantiates an ActionMap that will listen for actions from the UI or the keyboard. It will use GameState to get the keyboard bindings and send actions.

Parameters:
gameGameState - The current gameState of the CardBoard game.
gameWindow - The current gameWindow displaying the game
